body: Hi Ovilia: The "confidence-band" example is quiet a hack cause it uses a "base" value to shifts all y-values to be larger then 0 and fakes all lables and ticks.This is quite an bad idea cause I want to dynamicly add new values... how should I do this? Always calculating and applying a new base? Also this makes the code quiet complicated.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Though agree with "confidence-band" is somehow a hack, I'm afraid I don't think putting `fill` property in line series is reasonable. Envelop should not belongs to line serires, but directly to the chart.
Maybe in further features of drawing area markers (using line series/axis as boundery) or drawing such kind of envelops via a new kind of chart extensions will be added, but currently confidence-band hack is the most recommend way to implement such kind of effects.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
Maybe this is not a bug, you can use `borderColor` which means the `stroke` color here instead of `color` which means the `fill` color.
@susiwen8 I made a test, please review.ğŸ™‚

`npm i echarts@rc` is only installing `4.5.0-rc.2` - I'm assuming `4.8.0-rc.1` has yet to be published

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

By the way: there is a bug in the "confidence-band" example: Line 31: ``` return params[2].name + '
' + params[2].value; ``` should be ``` return params[2].name + '
' + (params[2].value - base) * 100; ``` to cover up the shifting-hack (the base value is 3) ![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3290888/81512602-fca38480-9321-11ea-8595-3d856dea834f.png)

Maybe it's a bug of `ngx-echarts` plugin since it seems to be working well if we call `setOption` manually in `click` callback function. This looks like that the plugin doesn't refresh the chart automatically after its option has been changed.
Is it fix?

@tomsoftware `base` value is used because ECharts handles stacking in the following logic: negative lines/bars stack with negative bars and positive with positive ones.

Yes.. chart is not getting updated automatically  but on opening developer
tools, I see that height is changing.

Till I open developer tools, there is no change in height.

Trying to find any workaround to refresh/reload to fix this issue

Hi, I was wondering if you ever plan to change this?

It's still happening in version 4.7.0.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45431828/81611486-5f376780-9398-11ea-8bc8-8800e76758c6.png)

It would be really nice if the outliers could line up with the boxes. Looking through old issues it looks like it did work in the past in [these screenshots](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/issues/9017). (Maybe I just don't know how to set it up correctly, but I've tried everything I can think of and there's nothing in the documentation)

@pissang / @susiwen8 I wonder if there are a list of items affected by theming, or is it better to dig through the code? It'd be great to understand which properties in the theme are inherited. Like I say, I'd be more than happy to pitch in the docs if I knew the limitations.

I made a new jsfiddle to show that if you try to adjust the labels after the chart has been drawn, it doesn't work, the problem remains.

https://jsfiddle.net/qbg210wn/2/

There are two buttons on the example clicking the first one should fix the axis labels (by adjusting the x axis data to contain new lines). 
Clicking the second one should make the problem mentioned in this issue appear in both charts.

Notice that clicking the button to fix the labels after you made the problem appear, does nothing !

Thank you for your time and effort,
Sergios.

Now there is [series-custom.itemStyle.borderType](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom.itemStyle.borderType) for specifying the type of border for all.
Do you want to specify a different `borderType` for each item in `renderItem` callback function or make `borderType` functional?
Does any one think which scheme will be better?

> Now there is [series-custom.itemStyle.borderType](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom.itemStyle.borderType) for specifying the type of border for all.
> Do you want to specify a different `borderType` for each item in `renderItem` callback function or make `borderType` functional?
> Does any one think which scheme will be better?

I see that all the properties in [series-custom.itemStyle](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom.itemStyle) have corresponding properties in `renderItem` callback function style except `borderType`. e.g. `borderColor` has the same meaning as `stroke`, `color` has the same meaning as `fill` but I can not find a corresponding property for `borderType` in the style of `renderItem` callback function. It is weird, isn't it? So I want to have a `lineType` to specify a different `borderType` for each item and I think it is reasonable.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ
